name: RR's 'Mansfield Park' Quiz | Austen, Jane | 10 Questions

questions.text: What are the names of Fanny's cousins, from eldest to youngest?
questions.explanation:
Tom, Edmund, Maria, Julia.

	Tom, as the eldest brother, is slated to become the new Sir Thomas when the old one dies.

questions.text: Why does Fanny live at Mansfield Park?
options: Her dad is the local clergyman.
questions.explanation:
She's the Bertrams' poor relation.

	Fanny's mother is Lady Bertram's sister. The Prices are poor and have many mouths to feed, so the Bertrams take Fanny in.

questions.text: With whom does Henry Crawford fall in love?
questions.explanation:
Fanny Price.

	Fanny thinks Henry's just toying with her, but he's actually in love.

questions.text: How do the Bertram sisters compare?
questions.correct: Both are spoilt and vain, but Julia is a little less so.
options: Maria is sensible, but Julia is overly romantic.
Both are kind and good, but Maria is prettier.
Julia is shy and kind, but Maria is spoilt and vain.
questions.explanation:
Both are spoilt and vain, but Julia is a little less so.

	Both sisters are pretty and self-centered, but Julia, the younger sister, is a shade nicer.

questions.text: Why does Mrs. Norris arrange for Fanny to come to Mansfield Park?
questions.correct: Mrs. N likes to be in charge of projects.
options: Mrs. N. wants a maidservant to live with her.
Mrs. N. wants Edmund to marry Fanny.
questions.explanation:
Mrs. N likes to be in charge of projects.

	Mrs. Norris is extremely officious--but she doesn't like Fanny at all.

questions.text: Why do Fanny and Edmund object to the others' plan to perform a play?
options: They think the play will offend Lady Bertram.
Aunt Norris has told them she objects.
They're afraid Tom won't act well.
questions.explanation:
They think it's improper.

	Edmund and Fanny have high moral standards. (Personally, I think they're prigs.)

Fanny's brother.

	Fanny's beloved brother William is in the navy. Henry Crawford helps him to get a promotion.

questions.text: Which word best describes Lady Bertram's character?
questions.explanation:
indolent.

	Lady Bertram spends most of the novel on the sofa with her tiny lapdog.

questions.text: In their last scene together, how does Mary Crawford act toward Edmund?
questions.explanation:
unapologetic and seductive.

	Edmund expects Mary to be ashamed of her brother, but she doesn't seem to be.

questions.text: Why do some literary critics dislike Fanny?
questions.correct: They think she's too mealy-mouthed and moralistic.
options: They think she's too sensible and unemotional.
They think she's too bold and improper.
They think she's too vain and self-centered.
questions.explanation:
They think she's too mealy-mouthed and moralistic.

	Read Marvin Mudrick's book on Jane Austen. He says some pretty scathing stuff about Fanny.
